result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrie L. Bucholtz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrie L. Bucholtz in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
All files heard: 15CF163, 15CF364, 15CF365, 15CF366
3:52 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Court questions Atty Barkley if he is under appointment. 
Atty Barkley indicates he is.  There is an appointment in 15CF163. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 

15CF163 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF364 Counts 1, 4, 7 & 10 - NO CONTEST
15CF365 Counts 1, 2 & 4 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Defendant and Atty Barkley agree to repeater status.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF163 Count 1, 15CF364 Counts 1, 4, 7 & 10, 15CF365 Counts 1 & 4..  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in are the following: 

15CF163 Counts 2 & 3
15CF364 Counts 2, 3, 5, 6, 8, 9, 11 & 12 
15CF365 Counts 2, 5 & 6
15CF366 in its entirety

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
  Asks that the bond that has been posted be applied to the restitution in 15CF163 and the restitution in 15CF366 be applied. Balance of bond to be applied to the 15CF365 file.  
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF163 Count 1 -
Sentence withheld.
24 months probation:
Pay restitution of $2.64 to be taken from the bond that's posted. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof. 
Reimburse Portage County for her attorney fees. 
Credit for 1 day. 

15CF364 Count 1 -
Sentence Withheld.
24 months probation, concurrent with all other probations
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF163. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
$1,538.06 restitution. At the request of the victim, civil judgment in favor of Copps Food Center. 

15CF364 Count 4 -
Sentence Withheld.
24 months probation, concurrent with all other probations
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF163. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF364 Count 7 -
Sentence Withheld.
24 months probation, concurrent with all other probations
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF163. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF364 Count 10 - 
Sentence Withheld.
24 months probation, concurrent with all other probations
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF163. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF365 Count 1 - 
Sentence Withheld.
24 months probation, concurrent with all other probations
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF163. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF365 Count 2 - 
Sentence Withheld.
24 months probation, concurrent with all other probations
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF163. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF365 Count 4 - 
Sentence Withheld.
24 months probation, concurrent with all other probations
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF163. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

The restitution in 15CF365 is $610.54 and court enters civil judgment in favor of Copps in that amount. 
The restitution in 15CF366 is $355.60 that will be paid from the bond in 15CF163. 
Any additional bond is to be applied to the fine and costs rather than the remaining restitution as civil judgments have been entered.

Defendant Terrie L. Bucholtz in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing on cases: 15CF366, 15CF365, & 15CF364
.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment: 15CF366, 15CF365, & 15CF364

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Terrie L. Bucholtz in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF364, 15CF365, 15CF366

  Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.


State recommends a $1500 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Bond covers all files in 15CF364.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
